thread.title: Middlesbrough 3-0 Sheffield Wednesday: Ten-man Boro cruise into FA Cup fourth round - 5 things we learned
thread.title_full: Middlesbrough 3-0 Sheffield Wednesday: Ten-man Boro cruise into FA Cup fourth round - 5 things we learned

author: Simon Bird
title: Middlesbrough 3-0 Sheffield Wednesday: Ten-man Boro cruise into FA Cup fourth round - 5 things we learned
text:
Middlesbrough are through to the fourth round of the FA Cup (Photo: Simon Cooper/PA Wire) Share   
Alvaro Negredo and Marten De Roon clinched the win for ten man Middlesbrough after Daniel Ayala was sent off. 
Spanish striker Negredo netted with a three yard charge down to help put Boro in the fourth round. 
Sheffield put up a spirited show in the first 55 minutes but crumbled. 
Grant Leadbitter broke the deadlock after a dreadful first half, Ayala saw red for a body-check, and De Roon finished the job late on. 
Our man Simon Bird was at the game, here are five things he learned... Grant Leadbitter opens the scoring (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 1. Alvaro Negredo scored from another FA Cup keeper calamity 
Sheff Wed keeper Joe Wildsmith had a nightmare. 
He got into a muddle with left back Daniel Pudil, faffing with the ball deep in the box. Wildsmith played the ball out wide, Pudil stroked it back into his six yard box. 
Negredo pounced to deflect Wildsmith's clearance in from three yards out. He'll not get an easier goal all season, but was sharp and alert to exploit the danger. 
The cock-up wasn't quite as bad as Ali Al-Habsi's error against Man U on Saturday. Daniel Ayala was sent off for Boro (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 2. Can Aitor Karanka produce goals and excitement as well as solidity? 
Boro have a reputation for hard-ball defence, and a well organised system. That has got them up to a place of safety in the Premier League. 
The only frustration has been their inability to rack up goals and action in attack on a consistent basis. 
Karanka is after new attacking recruits adding to new boy Rudy Gestede. 
But it took a trusty midfielder, Grant Leadbitter to grab Boro's goal with a 25 yard free kick. Negredo celebrates putting Boro 2-0 up (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 3. Daniel Ayala sent off for bad tackle 
The Spanish defender launched himself at Fernando Forestieri just a minute after Boro took the lead. 
The Sheffield star had knocked the ball in behind the defence and was sprinting into a dangerous position. 
Ayala ignored the ball and deliberately crashed into his opponent. It would not have looked out of place on a rugby field. Cristhian Stuani and Devante Rodney tussle during the game (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 4. “ We're on our way back,” sang the Owls away fans 
Befoe this game it was one defeat in nine games and five wins for Sheffield. 
Boss Carlos Carvalhal has got them well organised and it has paid dividends in the Championship with the club in a play-off place. 
They were Boro's equal and looked untroubled for much of the game, without being too adventurous themselves. 
Wednesday certainly seem a club heading in the right direction. Marten de Roon and Fernando Forestieri battle for possession (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 5. Is the fuss about Adama Traore justified? 
The Boro winger is one of the fastest players in the country, hitting 25mph on his dribbles. 
Bur he frustrates Karanka who has held him back and spent many and hour showing him his mistakes and demanding more team discipline. 
The former Barca star got a start here, wide on the left. He was well shackled. He had one good shot well blocked in the first half, a speedy break away and pass, but also annoyingly gave the ball away. 
Traore is loved by the Boro fans. He just has to convince Karanka he is worth more game time, especially when used as a counter attacker in away games. Like us on Facebook
